content: Hi, FHIR newbie here. I'm talking with Virginia Tech, maintainers of the veterinary SNOMED extension, about implementing an API that could be used to query for the ancestors and children of a given SNOMED concept identifier. I am wondering if there are FHIR specs that would be particularly useful to reference in designing this API. I saw the announcement from LOINC yesterday, which is what prompted me to think about this. Vet Med doesn't leverage FHIR today, but a potentially public-facing tool such as this would be great to build using FHIR as it would help speed up the API design, and (hopefully) insulate against one-off variations.

For your use-case, you probably want to explore the #terminology stream. But in short, yes, there are FHIR interfaces that would be relevant here. A good starting point is here: http://build.fhir.org/terminology-service.html

Lloyd, thanks. I don't have that stream on my hotlist yet, so I'll add it. Is there a way to move a post to a different stream, or is reposting better? (All of that may be moot if I get what I need from the link you shared, of course!)
No ability to move posts across streams, so you'll need to repost, but hopefully you'll find your initial answers in the spec and can then ask more refined questions :)
Yes, please post (or re-post) in terminology if you have more questions.
I agree with Lloyd that the FHIR terminology service API may be quite useful for what you are wanting to do.

In particular, look here http://build.fhir.org/snomedct.html#implicit with regards implicit ValueSets for SNOMED CT and the ValueSet/$expand operation http://build.fhir.org/valueset-operation-expand.html
